purgedConfiguration.description: The configuration '' was not checked because its code equals another one.

toomanyconfigs.description: Too many #ifdef configurations - cppcheck only checks 12 configurations. Use --force to check all configurations. For more details, use --enable=information.

AssignmentAddressToInteger.description: Assigning a pointer to an integer is not portable.

AssignmentIntegerToAddress.description: Assigning an integer to a pointer is not portable.

CastIntegerToAddressAtReturn.description: Returning an integer in a function with pointer return type is not portable.

CastAddressToIntegerAtReturn.description: Returning an address value in a function with integer return type is not portable.

assertWithSideEffect.description: Assert statement calls a function which may have desired side effects: 'function'.

autoVariables.description: Address of local auto-variable assigned to a function parameter.

danglingReference.description: Non-local reference variable 'x' to local variable 'y'

autovarInvalidDeallocation.description: Deallocation of an auto-variable results in undefined behaviour.

uselessAssignmentArg.description: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.

uselessAssignmentPtrArg.description: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function. Did you forget dereferencing it?

returnDanglingLifetime.description: Returning object that will be invalid when returning.

invalidLifetime.description: Using object that is out of scope.

danglingTemporaryLifetime.description: Using object that is a temporary.

assignBoolToFloat.description: Boolean value assigned to floating point variable.

comparisonOfFuncReturningBoolError.description: Comparison of a function returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.

comparisonOfTwoFuncsReturningBoolError.description: Comparison of two functions returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.

comparisonOfBoolWithBoolError.description: Comparison of a variable having boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.

incrementboolean.description: Incrementing a variable of type 'bool' with postfix operator++ is deprecated by the C++ Standard. You should assign it the value 'true' instead.

bitwiseOnBoolean.description: Boolean expression 'expression' is used in bitwise operation. Did you mean '&&'?

compareBoolExpressionWithInt.description: Comparison of a boolean expression with an integer other than 0 or 1.

pointerArithBool.description: Converting pointer arithmetic result to bool. The bool is always true unless there is undefined behaviour.

comparisonOfBoolWithInvalidComparator.description: Comparison of a boolean value using relational operator (<, >, <= or >=).

returnNonBoolInBooleanFunction.description: Non-boolean value returned from function returning bool

arrayIndexOutOfBounds.description: Array 'arr[16]' accessed at index 16, which is out of bounds.

arrayIndexOutOfBoundsCond.description: Array 'arr[16]' accessed at index 16, which is out of bounds.

arrayIndexThenCheck.description: Array index 'i' is used before limits check.

bufferAccessOutOfBounds.description: Buffer is accessed out of bounds: buf

objectIndex.description: The address of variable '' is accessed at non-zero index.

argumentSize.description: Buffer 'buffer' is too small, the function 'function' expects a bigger buffer in 2nd argument

negativeArraySize.description: Declaration of array '' with negative size is undefined behaviour

invalidFunctionArg.description: Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. The value is 0 or 1 (boolean) but the valid values are '1:4'.

invalidFunctionArgBool.description: Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. A non-boolean value is required.

invalidFunctionArgStr.description: Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. A nul-terminated string is required.

ignoredReturnValue.description: Return value of function malloc() is not used.

wrongmathcall.description: Passing value '#' to #() leads to implementation-defined result.

unpreciseMathCall.description: Expression '1 - erf(x)' can be replaced by 'erfc(x)' to avoid loss of precision.

memsetFloat.description: The 2nd memset() argument 'varname' is a float, its representation is implementation defined.

memsetValueOutOfRange.description: The 2nd memset() argument 'varname' doesn't fit into an 'unsigned char'.

missingReturn.description: Found an exit path from function with non-void return type that has missing return statement

returnStdMoveLocal.description: Using std::move for returning object by-value from function will affect copy elision optimization. More: https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#Rf-return-move-local

useStandardLibrary.description: Consider using memcpy instead of loop.

noConstructor.description: The class 'classname' does not declare a constructor although it has private member variables which likely require initialization.

noExplicitConstructor.description: Class 'classname' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.

copyCtorPointerCopying.description: Value of pointer 'var', which points to allocated memory, is copied in copy constructor instead of allocating new memory.

noCopyConstructor.description: Class 'class' does not have a copy constructor which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).

noOperatorEq.description: Class 'class' does not have a operator= which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).

noDestructor.description: Class 'class' does not have a destructor which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).

uninitMemberVar.description: Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor.

uninitMemberVarPrivate.description: Member variable 'classname::varnamepriv' is not initialized in the constructor.

uninitDerivedMemberVar.description: Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor. Maybe it should be initialized directly in the class classname?

uninitDerivedMemberVarPrivate.description: Member variable 'classname::varnamepriv' is not initialized in the constructor. Maybe it should be initialized directly in the class classname?

missingMemberCopy.description: Member variable 'classname::varnamepriv' is not assigned in the move constructor. Should it be moved?

operatorEqVarError.description: Member variable 'classname::' is not assigned a value in 'classname::operator='.

memsetClass.description: Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a classname.

memsetClassReference.description: Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a reference.

memsetClassFloat.description: Using memset() on class which contains a floating point number.

mallocOnClassWarning.description: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class provides constructors.

mallocOnClassError.description: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class contains a std::string.

virtualDestructor.description: Class 'Base' which is inherited by class 'Derived' does not have a virtual destructor.

thisSubtraction.description: Suspicious pointer subtraction. Did you intend to write '->'?

operatorEqMissingReturnStatement.description: No 'return' statement in non-void function causes undefined behavior.

operatorEqShouldBeLeftUnimplemented.description: 'operator=' should either return reference to 'this' instance or be declared private and left unimplemented.

operatorEqToSelf.description: 'operator=' should check for assignment to self to avoid problems with dynamic memory.

functionConst.description: Technically the member function 'class::function' can be const.

functionStatic.description: Technically the member function 'class::function' can be static (but you may consider moving to unnamed namespace).

initializerList.description: Member variable 'class::variable' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.

useInitializationList.description: Variable 'variable' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.

selfInitialization.description: Member variable 'var' is initialized by itself.

duplInheritedMember.description: The class 'class' defines member variable with name 'variable' also defined in its parent class 'class'.

copyCtorAndEqOperator.description: The class 'class' has 'operator=' but lack of 'copy constructor'.

missingOverride.description: The function '' overrides a function in a base class but is not marked with a 'override' specifier.

uselessOverride.description: The function '' overrides a function in a base class but just delegates back to the base class.

returnByReference.description: Function 'func()' should return member 'var' by const reference.

pureVirtualCall.description: Call of pure virtual function 'f' in constructor.

virtualCallInConstructor.description: Virtual function 'f' is called from constructor '' at line 1. Dynamic binding is not used.

thisUseAfterFree.description: Using member 'x' when 'this' might be invalid

unsafeClassRefMember.description: Unsafe class: The const reference member 'UnsafeClass::var' is initialized by a const reference constructor argument. You need to be careful about lifetime issues.

assignIfError.description: Mismatching assignment and comparison, comparison '' is always false.

badBitmaskCheck.description: Result of operator '|' is always true if one operand is non-zero. Did you intend to use '&'?

duplicateCondition.description: The if condition is the same as the previous if condition

multiCondition.description: Expression is always false because 'else if' condition matches previous condition at line 1.

mismatchingBitAnd.description: Mismatching bitmasks. Result is always 0 (X = Y & 0xf0; Z = X & 0x1; => Z=0).

oppositeInnerCondition.description: Opposite inner 'if' condition leads to a dead code block.

identicalInnerCondition.description: Identical inner 'if' condition is always true.

identicalConditionAfterEarlyExit.description: Identical condition 'x', second condition is always false

incorrectLogicOperator.description: Logical disjunction always evaluates to true: foo > 3 && foo < 4.

redundantCondition.description: Redundant condition: If x > 11 the condition x > 10 is always true.

moduloAlwaysTrueFalse.description: Comparison of modulo result is predetermined, because it is always less than 1.

clarifyCondition.description: Suspicious condition (assignment + comparison); Clarify expression with parentheses.

invalidTestForOverflow.description: Invalid test for overflow 'x + c < x'; signed integer overflow is undefined behavior. Some mainstream compilers remove such overflow tests when optimising the code and assume it's always false.

pointerAdditionResultNotNull.description: Comparison is wrong. Result of 'ptr+1' can't be 0 unless there is pointer overflow, and pointer overflow is undefined behaviour.

duplicateConditionalAssign.description: Duplicate expression for the condition and assignment.

assignmentInCondition.description: Suspicious assignment in condition. Condition 'x=y' is always true.

compareValueOutOfTypeRangeError.description: Comparing expression of type 'unsigned char' against value 256. Condition is always true.

exceptThrowInDestructor.description: Class Class is not safe, destructor throws exception

exceptDeallocThrow.description: Exception thrown in invalid state, 'p' points at deallocated memory.

exceptRethrowCopy.description: Throwing a copy of the caught exception instead of rethrowing the original exception.

catchExceptionByValue.description: Exception should be caught by reference.

throwInNoexceptFunction.description: Exception thrown in function declared not to throw exceptions.

unhandledExceptionSpecification.description: Unhandled exception specification when calling function foo().

rethrowNoCurrentException.description: Rethrowing current exception with 'throw;', it seems there is no current exception to rethrow. If there is no current exception this calls std::terminate(). More: https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/exceptions#throw-without-an-object

coutCerrMisusage.description: Invalid usage of output stream: '<< std::cout'.

fflushOnInputStream.description: fflush() called on input stream 'stdin' may result in undefined behaviour on non-linux systems.

IOWithoutPositioning.description: Read and write operations without a call to a positioning function (fseek, fsetpos or rewind) or fflush in between result in undefined behaviour.

readWriteOnlyFile.description: Read operation on a file that was opened only for writing.

writeReadOnlyFile.description: Write operation on a file that was opened only for reading.

useClosedFile.description: Used file that is not opened.

seekOnAppendedFile.description: Repositioning operation performed on a file opened in append mode has no effect.

incompatibleFileOpen.description: The file 'tmp' is opened for read and write access at the same time on different streams

invalidscanf.description: scanf() without field width limits can crash with huge input data.

wrongPrintfScanfArgNum.description: printf format string requires 3 parameters but only 2 are given.

invalidScanfArgType_s.description: %s in format string (no. 1) requires a 'char *' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidScanfArgType_int.description: %d in format string (no. 1) requires 'int *' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidScanfArgType_float.description: %f in format string (no. 1) requires 'float *' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_s.description: %s in format string (no. 1) requires 'char *' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_n.description: %n in format string (no. 1) requires 'int *' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_p.description: %p in format string (no. 1) requires an address but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_uint.description: %u in format string (no. 1) requires 'unsigned int' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_sint.description: %i in format string (no. 1) requires 'int' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidPrintfArgType_float.description: %f in format string (no. 1) requires 'double' but the argument type is Unknown.

invalidLengthModifierError.description: 'I' in format string (no. 1) is a length modifier and cannot be used without a conversion specifier.

invalidScanfFormatWidth.description: Width 5 given in format string (no. 10) is larger than destination buffer '[0]', use %-1s to prevent overflowing it.

invalidScanfFormatWidth_smaller.description: Width -1 given in format string (no. 99) is smaller than destination buffer '[0]'.

wrongPrintfScanfParameterPositionError.description: printf: referencing parameter 2 while 1 arguments given

deallocret.description: Returning/dereferencing 'p' after it is deallocated / released

doubleFree.description: Memory pointed to by 'varname' is freed twice.

leakNoVarFunctionCall.description: Allocation with funcName, funcName doesn't release it.

leakReturnValNotUsed.description: Return value of allocation function 'funcName' is not stored.

leakUnsafeArgAlloc.description: Unsafe allocation. If funcName() throws, memory could be leaked. Use make_shared<int>() instead.

publicAllocationError.description: Possible leak in public function. The pointer 'varname' is not deallocated before it is allocated.

unsafeClassCanLeak.description: Class 'class' is unsafe, 'class::varname' can leak by wrong usage.

deallocuse.description: Dereferencing 'varname' after it is deallocated / released

memleakOnRealloc.description: Common realloc mistake: 'varname' nulled but not freed upon failure

nullPointerDefaultArg.description: Possible null pointer dereference if the default parameter value is used: pointer

nullPointerRedundantCheck.description: Either the condition is redundant or there is possible null pointer dereference: pointer.

nullPointerArithmeticRedundantCheck.description: Either the condition is redundant or there is pointer arithmetic with NULL pointer.

zerodivcond.description: Either the condition is redundant or there is division by zero.

unusedScopedObject.description: Instance of 'varname' object is destroyed immediately.

invalidPointerCast.description: Casting between float * and double * which have an incompatible binary data representation.

shiftNegativeLHS.description: Shifting a negative value is technically undefined behaviour

shiftNegative.description: Shifting by a negative value is undefined behaviour

raceAfterInterlockedDecrement.description: Race condition: non-interlocked access after InterlockedDecrement(). Use InterlockedDecrement() return value instead.

invalidFree.description: Mismatching address is freed. The address you get from malloc() must be freed without offset.

overlappingWriteUnion.description: Overlapping read/write of union is undefined behavior

overlappingWriteFunction.description: Overlapping read/write in funcname() is undefined behavior

redundantCopyLocalConst.description: Use const reference for 'varname' to avoid unnecessary data copying.

redundantCopy.description: Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used.

comparisonFunctionIsAlwaysTrueOrFalse.description: Comparison of two identical variables with isless(varName,varName) always evaluates to false.

checkCastIntToCharAndBack.description: Storing func_name() return value in char variable and then comparing with EOF.

dangerousTypeCast.description: Potentially invalid type conversion in old-style C cast, clarify/fix with C++ cast

intToPointerCast.description: Casting non-zero decimal integer literal to pointer.

suspiciousFloatingPointCast.description: Floating-point cast causes loss of precision.

passedByValue.description: Function parameter '' should be passed by const reference.

constParameter.description: Parameter 'x' can be declared with const

constVariable.description: Variable 'x' can be declared with const

constParameterReference.description: Parameter 'x' can be declared with const

constVariableReference.description: Variable 'x' can be declared with const

constParameterPointer.description: Parameter 'x' can be declared with const

constVariablePointer.description: Variable 'x' can be declared with const

constParameterCallback.description: Parameter 'x' can be declared with const, however it seems that 'f' is a callback function.

constStatement.description: Redundant code: Found a statement that begins with type constant.

signedCharArrayIndex.description: Signed 'char' type used as array index.

charBitOp.description: When using 'char' variables in bit operations, sign extension can generate unexpected results.

variableScope.description: The scope of the variable 'varname' can be reduced.

redundantAssignInSwitch.description: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used. 'break;' missing?

suspiciousCase.description: Found suspicious case label in switch(). Operator '||' probably doesn't work as intended.

clarifyStatement.description: In expression like '*A++' the result of '*' is unused. Did you intend to write '(*A)++;'?

duplicateAssignExpression.description: Same expression used in consecutive assignments of 'x' and 'x'.

oppositeExpression.description: Opposite expression on both sides of '&&'.

duplicateExpression.description: Same expression on both sides of '&&'.

duplicateValueTernary.description: Same value in both branches of ternary operator.

duplicateExpressionTernary.description: Same expression in both branches of ternary operator.

duplicateBreak.description: Consecutive return, break, continue, goto or throw statements are unnecessary.

unreachableCode.description: Statements following return, break, continue, goto or throw will never be executed.

unsignedLessThanZero.description: Checking if unsigned expression 'varname' is less than zero.

unsignedPositive.description: Unsigned expression 'varname' can't be negative so it is unnecessary to test it.

pointerLessThanZero.description: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is.

pointerPositive.description: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is not.

suspiciousSemicolon.description: Suspicious use of ; at the end of '' statement.

incompleteArrayFill.description: Array 'buffer' is filled incompletely. Did you forget to multiply the size given to 'memset()' with 'sizeof(*buffer)'?

varFuncNullUB.description: Passing NULL after the last typed argument to a variadic function leads to undefined behaviour.

commaSeparatedReturn.description: Comma is used in return statement. The comma can easily be misread as a ';'.

redundantPointerOp.description: Redundant pointer operation on 'varname' - it's already a pointer.

unusedLabelConfiguration.description: Label '' is not used. There is #if in function body so the label might be used in code that is removed by the preprocessor.

unusedLabelSwitch.description: Label '' is not used. Should this be a 'case' of the enclosing switch()?

unusedLabelSwitchConfiguration.description: Label '' is not used. There is #if in function body so the label might be used in code that is removed by the preprocessor. Should this be a 'case' of the enclosing switch()?

unknownEvaluationOrder.description: Expression 'x = x++;' depends on order of evaluation of side effects

funcArgNamesDifferent.description: Function 'function' argument 2 names different: declaration 'A' definition 'B'.

redundantBitwiseOperationInSwitch.description: Redundant bitwise operation on 'varname' in 'switch' statement. 'break;' missing?

knownArgument.description: Argument 'x-x' to function 'func' is always 0. It does not matter what value 'x' has.

knownArgumentHiddenVariableExpression.description: Argument 'x*0' to function 'func' is always 0. Constant literal calculation disable/hide variable expression 'x'.

knownPointerToBool.description: Pointer expression 'p' converted to bool is always true.

comparePointers.description: Comparing pointers that point to different objects

redundantAssignment.description: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.

redundantInitialization.description: Redundant initialization for 'var'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.

funcArgOrderDifferent.description: Function 'function' argument order different: declaration '' definition ''

moduloofone.description: Modulo of one is always equal to zero

containerOutOfBounds.description: Out of bounds access in expression 'container[x]'

iterators1.description: Same iterator is used with different containers 'container1' and 'container2'.

iterators2.description: Same iterator is used with different containers 'container0' and 'container1'.

iterators3.description: Same iterator is used with containers 'container' that are temporaries or defined in different scopes.

invalidContainerLoop.description: Calling 'erase' while iterating the container is invalid.

invalidContainer.description: Using object that may be invalid.

mismatchingContainerIterator.description: Iterator 'it' referring to container 'v2' is used with container 'v1'.

mismatchingContainers.description: Iterators of different containers 'v1' and 'v2' are used together.

mismatchingContainerExpression.description: Iterators to containers from different expressions 'v1' and 'v2' are used together.

sameIteratorExpression.description: Same iterators expression are used for algorithm.

stlOutOfBounds.description: When i==foo.size(), foo[i] is out of bounds.

negativeContainerIndex.description: Array index -1 is out of bounds.

stlBoundaries.description: Dangerous comparison using operator< on iterator.

stlIfFind.description: Suspicious condition. The result of find() is an iterator, but it is not properly checked.

stlIfStrFind.description: Inefficient usage of string::find() in condition; string::starts_with() could be faster.

stlFindInsert.description: Searching before insertion is not necessary.

stlcstr.description: Dangerous usage of c_str(). The value returned by c_str() is invalid after this call.

stlcstrReturn.description: Returning the result of c_str() in a function that returns std::string is slow and redundant.

stlcstrParam.description: Passing the result of c_str() to a function that takes std::string as argument no. 0 is slow and redundant.

stlcstrthrow.description: Dangerous usage of c_str(). The value returned by c_str() is invalid after throwing exception.

StlMissingComparison.description: Missing bounds check for extra iterator increment in loop.

redundantIfRemove.description: Redundant checking of STL container element existence before removing it.

uselessCallsCompare.description: It is inefficient to call 'str.find(str)' as it always returns 0.

uselessCallsSwap.description: It is inefficient to swap a object with itself by calling 'str.swap(str)'

uselessCallsSubstr.description: Ineffective call of function 'substr' because it returns a copy of the object. Use operator= instead.

uselessCallsEmpty.description: Ineffective call of function 'empty()'. Did you intend to call 'clear()' instead?

uselessCallsRemove.description: Return value of std::remove() ignored. Elements remain in container.

derefInvalidIterator.description: Possible dereference of an invalid iterator: i

eraseIteratorOutOfBounds.description: Calling function 'erase()' on the iterator 'iter' which is out of bounds.

eraseIteratorOutOfBoundsCond.description: Either the condition 'x' is redundant or function 'erase()' is called on the iterator 'iter' which is out of bounds.

useStlAlgorithm.description: Consider using  algorithm instead of a raw loop.

knownEmptyContainer.description: Iterating over container 'var' that is always empty.

globalLockGuard.description: Lock guard is defined globally. Lock guards are intended to be local. A global lock guard could lead to a deadlock since it won't unlock until the end of the program.

localMutex.description: The lock is ineffective because the mutex is locked at the same scope as the mutex itself.

sizeofwithsilentarraypointer.description: Using 'sizeof' on array given as function argument returns size of a pointer.

pointerSize.description: Size of pointer 'varname' used instead of size of its data.

sizeofDivisionMemfunc.description: Division by result of sizeof(). memset() expects a size in bytes, did you intend to multiply instead?

sizeofwithnumericparameter.description: Suspicious usage of 'sizeof' with a numeric constant as parameter.

multiplySizeof.description: Multiplying sizeof() with sizeof() indicates a logic error.

divideSizeof.description: Division of result of sizeof() on pointer type.

sizeofVoid.description: Behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.

sizeofDereferencedVoidPointer.description: '*varname' is of type 'void', the behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.

arithOperationsOnVoidPointer.description: 'varname' is of type 'vartype'. When using void pointers in calculations, the behaviour is undefined.

stringLiteralWrite.description: Modifying string literal directly or indirectly is undefined behaviour.

sprintfOverlappingData.description: Undefined behavior: Variable 'varname' is used as parameter and destination in s[n]printf().

strPlusChar.description: Unusual pointer arithmetic. A value of type 'char' is added to a string literal.

incorrectStringCompare.description: String literal "Hello World" doesn't match length argument for substr().

literalWithCharPtrCompare.description: String literal compared with variable 'foo'. Did you intend to use strcmp() instead?

charLiteralWithCharPtrCompare.description: Char literal compared with pointer 'foo'. Did you intend to dereference it?

incorrectStringBooleanError.description: Conversion of string literal "Hello World" to bool always evaluates to true.

incorrectCharBooleanError.description: Conversion of char literal 'x' to bool always evaluates to true.

overlappingStrcmp.description: The expression 'strcmp(x,"def") != 0' is suspicious. It overlaps 'strcmp(x,"abc") == 0'.

shiftTooManyBits.description: Shifting 32-bit value by 40 bits is undefined behaviour

shiftTooManyBitsSigned.description: Shifting signed 32-bit value by 31 bits is undefined behaviour

signConversion.description: Expression 'var' can have a negative value. That is converted to an unsigned value and used in an unsigned calculation.

truncLongCastAssignment.description: int result is assigned to long variable. If the variable is long to avoid loss of information, then you have loss of information.

truncLongCastReturn.description: int result is returned as long value. If the return value is long to avoid loss of information, then you have loss of information.

floatConversionOverflow.description: Undefined behaviour: float (1e+100) to integer conversion overflow.

uninitdata.description: Memory is allocated but not initialized: varname

unusedAllocatedMemory.description: Variable 'varname' is allocated memory that is never used.

unreadVariable.description: Variable 'varname' is assigned a value that is never used.

unassignedVariable.description: Variable 'varname' is not assigned a value.

postfixOperator.description: Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.

va_start_wrongParameter.description: 'arg1' given to va_start() is not last named argument of the function. Did you intend to pass 'arg2'?

va_start_referencePassed.description: Using reference 'arg1' as parameter for va_start() results in undefined behaviour.

va_end_missing.description: va_list 'vl' was opened but not closed by va_end().

va_list_usedBeforeStarted.description: va_list 'vl' used before va_start() was called.

va_start_subsequentCalls.description: va_start() or va_copy() called subsequently on 'vl' without va_end() in between.

missingIncludeSystem.description: Include file: <> not found. Please note: Cppcheck does not need standard library headers to get proper results.

invalidConstFunctionType.description: It is unspecified behavior to const qualify a function type.

class_X_Y.description: The code '   ' is not handled. You can use -I or --include to add handling of this code.

macroWithSemicolon.description: Ensure that '' is defined either using -I, --include or -D.
